title: Jaylen Brown continues to shine as Celtics hold off furious 76ers run, win third straight: 9 takeaways
author: Tom Westerholm
bullets: Jaylen Brown scored 32 points as the Boston Celtics narrowly defeated the Philadelphia 76ers 109-108, marking their third consecutive win.
Despite a late-game rally by the 76ers, the Celtics held on to win their first game in the NBA Cup’s Group B play.
Anfernee Simons played aggressively, contributing to the Celtics' lead but struggled under pressure during the second half.

title: Julia Fox defends controversial Jackie O. Halloween costume
author: Morgan Rousseau
bullets: Julia Fox faced backlash for a Halloween costume resembling Jacqueline Kennedy's bloodied pink suit from JFK's assassination.
Jack Schlossberg criticized Fox's costume as glorifying political violence, calling it "disgusting, desperate and dangerous."
Fox defended her choice as an artistic statement on trauma, power, and Jackie Kennedy's act of bravery.

title: Falcons QB Michael Penix Jr., WR Drake London set to play vs. Patriots
author: Kaley Brown
bullets: Falcons QB Michael Penix Jr. and WR Drake London will play against the Patriots after recovering from injuries.
Drake London, ranked as the NFL's sixth top WR, averages 78.2 yards per game with 38 catches and two touchdowns.
Patriots' Christian Gonzalez, ranked top in coverage, prepares for a key matchup against London's receiving prowess.

title: Craig Breslow believes Red Sox are in ‘improved position’ to get ‘right players’ this offseason
author: Conor Roche
bullets: Craig Breslow believes the Red Sox are better positioned to acquire key players after their 2025 playoff appearance.
Breslow recognizes holes in the roster with Alex Bregman, Lucas Giolito, and Trevor Story's contract decisions looming.
Red Sox have $25M under the luxury tax threshold and a strong farm system to bolster their offseason strategy.

title: Mike Vrabel says recent Patriots changes have nothing to do with wanting to separate from the past
author: Conor Roche
bullets: Mike Vrabel insists Patriots changes are not about separating from past success as head coach in his first season.
Recent changes include individual player introductions instead of team introductions before Week 8 victory against the Browns.
Vrabel emphasizes focus on winning and creating an enjoyable environment, with team leading AFC East at 6-2 record.

title: Bruins’ Elias Lindholm will miss ‘a few weeks’, Khusnutdinov promoted to 1C
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Elias Lindholm will miss several weeks due to a lower-body injury sustained during a game against the Sabres.
Marat Khusnutdinov is promoted to the Bruins' top line, skating with David Pastrnak and Morgan Geekie.
Lindholm had four power-play goals this season, impacting the Bruins' 13th-ranked special teams unit.

title: Photos: The best moments from Salem on Halloween 2025
author: Kelly Chan
bullets: Tourists in full costume filled Salem, Massachusetts, on Halloween 2025, the busiest day of the year for the city.
Essex Street featured costumed visitors, markets, street performances, and decorative lights capturing the Halloween atmosphere.
Many posed with costumed characters and visited landmarks like the Salem Witch Trials Memorial and haunted museums.

title: Moulton, without proof, accuses Trump of abusing girls with Epstein in tense TV interview
author: Ross Cristantiello
bullets: Rep. Seth Moulton accused President Trump of abusing girls with Jeffrey Epstein, without providing evidence, during a TV interview.
Moulton's comments came during a tense exchange with MSNBC's Joe Scarborough, who noted the lack of proof for the claims.
Moulton is running against Sen. Ed Markey in the 2026 Democratic primary, highlighting Trump's alleged misconduct as a campaign point.

title: Brian Walshe’s next court appearance scheduled as cellphone evidence remains accessible
author: Beth Treffeisen
bullets: Brian Walshe's trial begins with jury selection on Nov. 18, aiming to conclude by Christmas.
Cellphone data crucial to the Walshe case remains accessible following a court decision to preserve the evidence.
Norfolk Judge Krupp blocks cellphone data destruction from former State Trooper Proctor, linked to other cases.

title: Star Market over the Mass. Pike reopens after asbestos scare
author: Beth Treffeisen
bullets: Star Market over Massachusetts Turnpike reopened after a three-day shutdown due to an asbestos scare.
Asbestos was contained in a sealed stockroom at Star Market, posing no risk to shoppers, according to inspectors.
MassDEP confirmed the area with asbestos has been contained; ongoing abatement measures will continue without public risk.
